alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Concho (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Brown, Coleman and northeastern Concho Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1130 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Talpa, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Coleman, Early, Santa Anna, Bangs, Blanket, Gouldbusk, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Cross Cut, Glen Cove, Zephyr, Voss, Lake Brownwood State Park, Silver Valley, Leaday, Lake Brownwood, Byrds and Ivie Reservoir Near Concho Park Marina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
